member.name: M:OpenRiaServices.Controls.EntityCollectionView.EditItem(System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an editing transaction on the given item. The transaction is completed by calling either or . Any changes made to the item during the transaction are considered "pending", provided that the view supports the notion of "pending changes" for the given item.
member.remarks: While it's possible that the underlying collection doesn't support editing, the interface does not have a mechanism for specifying that CanEdit is false. Throwing an exception if editing is disallowed would lead to a crash when attempting to edit the item, without being able to check for the condition beforehand. By allowing this operation to succeed, the caller when then get an exception only if changes are made on the entity's properties, and that can surface as a validation error in the UI.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.PagedEntityCollectionView.ItemCount
member.summary: Gets a count of items known to be in the source collection after filtering is applied, but before paging.
member.remarks: Value is based on the number of items that have been loaded and what pages those items were loaded into. If of 0 or 1 were never loaded, but of 2 was loaded successfully, then we can assume that page indexes of 0 and 1 exist and are full.
member.example:
While on of 2 (the 3rd page), with of 5, and the page having 5 items, the return value will be at least 15.
If the has been greater than 2 previously, we know that items exist beyond the 3rd page, so the return value could be greater than 15.

member.remarks: The provider of the source collection is in charge of setting this value. In those cases, the value can be temporary only. member.name: M:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.CancelSubmit
member.summary: Cancels the current submit operation performed by this , if any.
member.remarks:
This method will cancel a operation already in progress. Operations canceled using will raise a event when they complete with the flag set to true. If is false, this method will not do anything. This method of cancellation differs slightly from canceling a submit via the event.
Upon completion of the operation, check the property to determine whether or not the operation was successfully canceled. Note that cancellation of the operation does not guarantee state changes were prevented from happening on the server.

member.name: E:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.SubmittedChanges
member.summary: Event raised whenever a submit operation is completed.
member.remarks: This event is raised on the completion of an asynchronous operation. If the operation was canceled via , the flag will be true. Also, exceptions that occurred during the operation will be available on . If the submit was canceled from the event, this event will not be raised. Also, if there were no changes this event will not be raised.

member.name: E:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadedData
member.summary: Event raised whenever a load operation is completed.
member.remarks: This event is raised on the completion of an asynchronous operation. If the operation was canceled via , the flag will be true. Also, exceptions that occurred during the operation will be available on . If the load was canceled from the event, this event will not be raised.

member.name: E:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadingData
member.summary: Event raised whenever a load operation is launched.
member.remarks: This event is raised from and allows a handler to cancel the load before it begins. When a handler sets to true, the load will be aborted and a subsequent event will not be raised. This differs slightly from canceling a load via .

member.name: E:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.SubmittingChanges
member.summary: Event raised whenever a submit operation is launched.
member.remarks: This event is raised from and allows a handler to cancel the submit before it begins. When a handler sets to true, the submit will be aborted and a subsequent event will not be raised. This differs slightly from canceling a submit via .

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay between the time a change that prompts an automatic load occurs and the time the subsequent is invoked.
member.remarks: Multiple changes that occur within the specified time span are aggregated into a single operation. For every change that occurs, the delay timer is reset. This allows many changes to be combined into a single call as long as each change occurs within the specified delay from the last. Once the delay timer is allowed to elapse without a change occurring, will be invoked.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the pause duration between two successive load operations in progressive loads.
member.remarks: Progressive loads allow entities to be loaded in the background when a is specified, and is set to 0.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items to load each time a is executed. When equal to 0, all requested entities will be loaded.
member.remarks: When and are both non-zero, entities will be loaded using the multiple of nearest , allowing multiple pages to be loaded at once without loading partial pages.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.LoadTimer
member.summary: Gets or sets a timer used to aggregate auto-load requests before loading.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.DomainDataSource.PageSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the number of items displayed on each page of the view returned from and , or 0 to disable paging.
A non-zero page size will cause the number of entities loaded with each operation to be limited as well, using server-side paging.
member.remarks: When and are both non-zero, entities will be loaded using the multiple of nearest , allowing multiple pages to be loaded at once without loading partial pages.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.FilterDescriptor.IgnoredValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for the right operand for which this filter should be ignored.
member.remarks:
If matches , this filter will not be applied to the load query by the . The is compared to twice in the . First, it is strictly compared using an comparison. Second, both values are converted to type of the property specified by the and compared again. If either conversion matches, this filter is ignored.
For example, the following Value/IgnoredValue pairs will all match for an integer property and result in the filter being ignored: 0/0, 0/"0", "0"/"0", and "0"/0.
This property is set to by default. The default value will only match if is also set to .

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.FilterDescriptor.IsCaseSensitive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the filter is case sensitive for string values.
member.remarks: When this is true, the load query in the will represent case sensitivity. However, it is not guaranteed that the data store used by the domain service will also respect case sensitivity.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.FilterDescriptor.Operator
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter operator.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.FilterDescriptor.PropertyPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property path used as the left operand.

member.name: P:OpenRiaServices.Controls.FilterDescriptor.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the right operand.
member.remarks: This will be used by the to compose a filter for the load query. It will be applied following the pattern [Entity].[PropertyPath] [Operator] [Value]. For example, a query might look like Customer.Name == "CurrentCustomerName".
